abstract: Leaders of the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employes and the Writers Guild of America West traded strong words over the mounting costs of their strikes.
snippet: Leaders of the International Alliance of Theatrical Stage Employes and the Writers Guild of America West traded strong words over the mounting costs of their strikes.
lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES, Nov. 14 — The entertainment industry’s labor dispute boiled over anew yesterday, with the leaders of two striking unions criticizing each other and the Walt Disney Company lambasting the tactics of a third guild.

headline.main: Leaders of Two Striking Entertainment Unions Clash
headline.print_headline: Leaders of Two Striking Entertainment Unions Clash

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: ALLIANCE OF MOTION PICTURE AND TELEVISION PRODUCERS
